review_title: Proud to be part of PSU
pros: It is a really good experience to be part of the PSU
cons: I did not find anything negative about PSU

pros: Great faculty and staff that want to see you succeed
cons: Lacking in class variety for grad school

pros: Great community (in Pittsburg and within the PSU staff). Academic freedom to create/teach courses.
cons: Pay is reasonable, but not fair - others who are hired after you may/probably will make more than you. Different chairs for each department with not a lot of consistency throughout org. Not worth the money to adjunct a course. New president --- we shall see how it affects current positions.

pros: Easy to teach online (good LMS)
cons: Difficult getting responses from HR

pros: Coworkers and students are friendly
cons: Management of the Physical Plant is laughably poor. None of my current managers are even remotely competent. I did have a good manager for a couple of years but she was worked half to death and escaped. From my admittedly relatively narrow view there's far too much middle management doing next to nothing in every nook and cranny of the campus. Meanwhile continued poor pay, layoffs and retirement has led to a shortage of manpower amongst the poorest paid, yet critical service staff.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Pittsburg, KS
pros: PSU is a great place to work and gain experience while obtaining a dynamic degree. More specifically, I was obtaining my masters degree in polymer chemistry and conducting research for my masters thesis. PSU does a great job with their graduate research assistant positions, allowing their students to obtain their degree, but to also make some money while they are doing it.
cons: The only downside was that we could only work 20 hours a week. While our schooling is important and should come first, it would have been nice to at least have the option to work more hours to make more money as long as our grades did not suffer.

review_title: Can be great, can be really tough. Luck of the draw.
pros: They waive your tuition and still pay about $500 per month, which can really help for getting through grad school without additional loans.
cons: Everything depends on which professor your assigned to assist. Some overwork their GAs as if they are there to basically do the professor's job for them, whereas others treat you more like colleagues and just ask for some help here and there. You are paid for 20 hours of work no matter what, but some professors have you doing five hours per week, others have you doing 30.

review_title: I love this school. They do everything possible to make sure you have the best chances for success.
pros: As a GA, I learn best by teaching the material. At Pitt State, you're surrounded by people in the same boat as you are: teaching and your Master's program.
cons: Not much money. At all.

review_title: Good place to work as a student graduate assistant
pros:
Fun place to work. 
Lots of skills developed.
Flexible employer that worked well with your schedule.
Good money for a student employee.
cons:
Unprofessional environment at times
Work was sometimes too menial for my liking
Not much opportunity for becoming a full time employee

pros: I worked as an advertising representative for the campus newspaper. It was a flexible works schedule and good job for a student.
cons: The pay was based off of commssion and how many ads you sold, so you never had a set pay check. As a college student, that made it hard.

review_title: Sincere interest in their student employees' well-being and future
job_title: Peer Advisor/Data Entry (Career Services) in Pittsburg, KS
pros: Friendly co-workers, ability to grow within the department, they actually care about you. I worked in the Career Services office during my sophomore year of college, and I found it to be a very good job. The staff I worked with was really great to their employees. I learned a lot at that job and made great friendships.
cons: The student workers have to be paid minimum wage.

pros: Tuition is paid for and you have the freedom to teach in the area that interests you. You must apply for this position to be considered.
cons: This is only a temporary appt, and it does not pay well. But one gets the experience of university teaching.

job_title: Student Office Assistant in Pittsburg, KS
pros: Relaxed Environment, Wonderful Bosses, Calm and Pleasant People/Co Workers, Works around you class times.
cons: Pay is Lower however the pros are just so good it is not a huge draw back.

pros: I was classified as an Administrative Graduate Assistant. It paid pretty well and the office I was in was not too busy. I had times when I could work on school work. Some of the things I did for the position were good learning experiences.
cons: There were a few times where I was basically acting as the custodian.

review_title: Awesome place to consider working if you're a student
pros: It's an amazing place to work! I've gained a lot of experience as a photojournalist and have created a network of people in the process. If you want to work here, I'd highly recommend it!
cons: I only wish I got paid more, but that's a thing a lot of us wish.

review_title: Just a minimum wage job on campus
pros: Part- time, easy, flexible hours, work around students and are very organized. I don't really do much. Can not think of anything else
cons: Minimum wage, no windows in my office, my boss is in a different building. I do not really do much at my job so it can get boring.

pros: Great Experience for anybody looking for communication skills.
cons: Low hours for students, although I can get 10 more then the average student. The will be no more student dispatchers for the third shift on weekdays and possibly the weekends, so my job is going the way of the dinosaur on July first.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Pittsburg, KS
pros: A great place to study and show case our talent. Being a student means versatility for a  foreigners like me.
cons: I do not have anything negative about the university but I think it's the market to blame. Majority of the graduate foreign students do not get a job as easily as a native student.

job_title: Graduate Assistant In the Office of Career Services in Pittsburg, KS
pros: Flexibility to student schedules is necessary for graduate assistants to balance homework load and hours.
cons: Parking options are awful.  This is my biggest complaint.  It is not a priority of the administration whatsoever.

pros: Great culture, they treat people as people. Provide actual experience that adds value to a resume. Once you graduate if you cultivate relationships a full time position is a possibility.
cons: Minimum wage for all student workers
